name: Taqueria Coatzingo
address: 76-05 Roosevelt Ave, Jackson Heights, NY 11372, USA

reviews.text: Wow..! Que valor el que cocino la sopa de pancita de res no me explico como me pudieron servir esa sopa yo estaba por hechar las tripas del mal olor que tenia esa sopa eso fue un asco.
Dont listen to the bad reviews, they aren't true. This place is a great for mexican food, their tortas, truly amazing. I love it, iv been eating here for years and they still have that amazing taste.
Una excelente opci√≥n para degustar de unos muy buenos tacos. Tienen todo tipo de comida

First time here, got to try the carne asada tacos and carnitas chalupas, they were great! Juicy and tender. Our only issue was when we arrived there wasn‚Äôt any music playing for a while and out of nowhere loud music started playing which threw us off as we were sitting by a speaker. Will probably do take out moving forward because these tacos are definitely seeing me again.
The meat was tender, the salsa verde bright and flavorful, and the atmosphere full of energy. Highly recommend for a genuine experience.

The team at Taqueria Coatzingo makes you feel like family. I stop by at least once per month for tacos. They are made to order and very filling. Three is my absolute max. I recommend starting with one or two. Do not eat the green chili pepper if you cannot handle spice.
The food is very delicious. The drinks slap and the service is speedy and attentive. Highly recommend this place. Came here last night and the place was PACKED!!!
Best ever Mexican food ate in Queens NY. I feel like I'm in Mexico every time I visit this place, the music, the service, and especially the food.

I‚Äôve been eating at this restaurant since 2007 and have tried many of the menu items throughout the years. This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in NY. I‚Äôve tried several different Mexican restaurants and food trucks, and so far, this is the most authentic and delicious in flavor that I‚Äôve experienced in New York. It reminds me of the hole-in-the-wall restaurants I‚Äôve eaten at in Puerto Vallarta.

There are other Mexican spots in the area that taste authentic, but the quality and flavor don‚Äôt compare to this restaurant. The food here is very flavorful and excellent in quality! The way they season their dishes is just so good.

My favorite is the quesadillas mixtas with rice and frijoles (so creamy and delicious here). I also really like their horchatas, jugo de tamarindo, and their pi√±a coladas‚Äîthe perfect balance of sweetness and alcohol. My favorite pi√±a coladas on Roosevelt Ave come from this place üôåüèΩ. The consistency is spot on: not too watery, not too thick.

They also serve delicious nachos, salsa, guac, burritos, fajitas‚Äîyou name it. Their complimentary salsa is my absolute favorite! It‚Äôs homemade, a little sweet, a little spicy, and absolutely delicious.

I love this place so much that I‚Äôve been a loyal customer for nearly 20 years.
Este lugar asido mi lugar preferido en comida mexicana pero Ped√≠ chilaquiles Rojos??pero son los peores chilaquiles que he comido

Coatzingo Taquer√≠a is one of those places that truly makes a difference when you‚Äôre looking for authentic Mexican food in New York. From the moment you walk in, the atmosphere immediately transports you to Mexico. The entire decoration is fully Mexican, filled with details that make you feel as if you were eating tacos at a traditional market. That authenticity sets it apart and makes the whole experience so much more special than just going to a regular taco spot.

The food is outstanding. I tried several tacos, and without a doubt, the tripe taco was the best I‚Äôve ever had‚Äîperfectly cooked, with amazing flavor and just the right texture. The al pastor tacos are also delicious, with a truly authentic taste that‚Äôs hard to find outside of Mexico. The guacamole has excellent flavor, fresh and well-prepared, although I did find the portion quite small compared to the $10 price. Still, I have to admit the taste itself was really good.

The service is another highlight. The person who took care of my table was attentive, always checking in and making great recommendations to make sure I had a good experience from start to finish. That kind of hospitality makes a big difference and is definitely appreciated.

If there‚Äôs one thing I would add, it would be Mexican music playing in the background. The place already has the authentic d√©cor and amazing food, and adding traditional music would complete the atmosphere and make it feel 100% like being in Mexico.

Overall, Coatzingo Taquer√≠a is definitely a place I recommend if you‚Äôre in New York and want to enjoy real tacos. The quality of the food, the unique Mexican atmosphere, and the good service make it worth the visit. If you‚Äôre looking for a spot that takes you to Mexico with every bite, this is the place to go

Camarones a la Veracruzana. Chex Quesadilla. And the Modelos Micheladas üòãüòãüòã
Food. Drinks and Service. Thank You. Nos Vemos Pronto.
My last experience, the waitress gave me a lovely service, so friendly. Food is always good but El mole de olla no es lo suyo

First time here and it immediately became one of my top Mexican spots. I had the chilaquiles verdes con cecina and my husband had the birria con queso tacos and a shrimp taco. Complementary chip and salsa are top notch. Everything was amazing, we‚Äôll be back very often.
Un excelente restaurant en queens para comer
(4.3/5 ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è) They are generous in portions and their saz√≥n is good ! Def worth it ! Be careful confusing the spots as there are a few close to each other but not the same !
Excellent - Authentic

el servicio es horrendo lo recomiendo
llegue a pedir una mesa
me mandaron para el otro lado y tampoco me dieron mesa por que no tenian y eso que habia 4 disponibles
termine por sentarme en la barra y aguantarme el hambre e irme a comer otro lugar
Late night lengua tacos hits

There are a handful of restaurants that are a must stop for me whenever I‚Äôm back in Queens and this place is heavily on my rotation. I‚Äôve been coming to this spot with my dad since I was in middle school(now late 20‚Äôs), this place has a very special place in my heart. Everything is pretty homey, you can‚Äôt go wrong with most dishes. My dish here is four carne asada tacos but recently I‚Äôve switched over to their Birria; their consume is so rich.

I love this place, there‚Äôs many Mexican restaurants near by but this place is the best in my opinion!

I want to start by saying that the food Taqueria Cuatzingo was absolutely amazing. Everything I ordered was fresh, flavorful, and authentic, -you can tell the kitchen takes the great pride in the quality of the dishes. I would return for the food alone!
However, I was disappointed with the service during my visit. Unfortunately, the waitress who served me, had a very unpleasant attitude-she spoke in a condescending, almost confrontational tone, which made the experience uncomfortable. I don‚Äôt know her name, but she was working around 1:00PM on July 11. Service is an esencial part of the dining experience , and hospitality makes a big difference, especially when it comes to Tips and customer loyalty.
I respectfully suggest that management address this issue. A great meal should be paired with a welcoming, friendly atmosphere. I‚Äôd love to keep supporting this business -and I‚Äôm sure many others would too- if the service could match the excellence of the food.
Thank you so much for your time.

Affectionately,
John Spinosa.

I now understand why it's hard to get reservations here. The dishes showed unexpected finesse. The individual items are reasonably priced, though complete meals cost more. Most importantly, staff demonstrates authentic warmth. The complete visit offered consistent pleasure.
Excellent food, great service, will be back!

We had a great meal here. Delicious chips and guac to start, and some very tasty beef enchiladas with great hot sauce, and micheladas. My friend got the el pastor tacos and was raving about them too, but my portion was so generous I had no room to try hers. Staff were friendly and attentive and we would definitely go again.

No estoy segura, pero definitivamente la calidad ha cambiado desde la √∫ltima vez que vine. El pollo estaba tan duro que ni siquiera se pod√≠a comer. Estoy muy segura de que se dieron cuenta de que el pollo no estaba bien y aun as√≠ decidieron servirlo, no una, sino dos veces. Tambi√©n se equivocaron con el pedido y tuvimos que esperar alrededor de una hora por la comida. No volver√©.
Price wasn‚Äôt expensive. Food and drinks were delicious.
Excellent!
Los mejores tacos de todo NY

La comida est√°  buena la atenci√≥n es buena un lugar. Familiar bueno para comer cenar con la familia  pero la limpieza en los ba√±os s√∫per mala  y si que  le recomiendo este lugar para comer. Disfruten de sus platillos pero no vallan al ba√±o
Excellent place .
Love this restaurant
Muy buena la comida y la atencion 10 de 10
love the tostadas

Comida riqu√≠sima como siempre!! Unos de mis restaurantes favoritos. Tengan cuidado cuando les llegue el cheque las mesera se ponen autom√°ticamente la propina sin dar nada de servicio m√°s q tomar la orden y despu√©s aparecer cuando es hora de pagar no ofrecen ni un vaso de agua
Best mexican place I've been to ever.
This is my favorite restaurant when it comes to Mexican food. I don't live near by but I've been coming here for years. The food may take a while to hit the table but the wait is more than worth it.
Been coming here since 2011, great service and great food. Recommend the nachos texanos with carne asada. Please tip your waiters as well
Buena comida, buen servicio yo personalmente ped√≠ la fajina mixta y me encant√≥ y mi esposo orden√≥ los tacos de birria y estaban muy bueno.
The best tacos and quesadillas I tried so far in New York üòãüåÆ
Nice place to eat mexican food. And a Michelada beer.
Fui a comprar una pansita grande y Me dieron una peque√±a y me cobraron como una grande
I recomend to try the Molcajete dish it's the bestüëç
Mucho mejor !que el legendario tacos m√©xico
Un lugar para ir con familia o sin o con amigos.las meseras muy amables profesionales.y la comida ni que se diga las cemitas los tacos y mucho m√°s se los recomiendo Amis amigos y familiares .
Yummy tacos

The food was great. Their Tacos de al pastor always hit.  The service is alright. Not the greatest. They could do better. Now one thing about this place is that they don‚Äôt tell you about the 20% service fee. No where in their establishment is it placed. Not on the menus, the walls or even on the receipt. I mean if the service were to be good I get it but it‚Äôs not.

The worse chicken pepian ever they gave me left overs bones and I spoke to the manager. He said he mentioned to the kitchen not to do that again hahahaha‚Ä¶ I work in the industry and Im glad he is not my manager. What a shame with the guest.
Food was amazing and the staff was friendly & extremely accommodating. I will be returning soon!

Ordered the mixed enchiladas platter, a red beef soup, and 2 tacos. The enchiladas hit a craving I‚Äôve had for a while. I feel like a lot of places in NYC don‚Äôt do them right, this place does though. I found them to be delicious. Red sauce is better than green sauce. The soup was also really good, very flavorful and spiced well. Something I‚Äôve never had before!

Tacos were alright. Not the best I‚Äôve had in NYC, but were decent. I think too much guacamole‚Ä¶ and I love guacamole.

Free chips & salsa at the start, good salsa too. Try something you‚Äôve never had before on this menu, you‚Äôll surprise yourself.

I enjoyed my soft tacos here, shrimp, pig ear and beef tongue-could‚Äôve been more tender in a melt in your mouth way but some parts were a little tough. The pig ear was best!

Large restaurant they a have space you can probably close off for private events. Attentive and efficient service.

They allowed vendors in which was annoying. That is the only thing that ruined the atmosphere for me.

Lunch here was a bit of a mixed bag. I do like the fact that they bring out complementary chips and salsa as you order - though the salsa was a bit sweet for my taste. The two tacos I ordered - carnitas and carne asada - were also decent. But the flautas were where they really failed - the chicken was dry and lacked flavor and the tortilla shells were not very crispy. I can‚Äôt say anything about the rest of the menu but best to avoid the flautas.

The food was really good. We ordered chilaquiles and tacos (carne asada, pastor and birria).
I would definitely be coming back. My only feedback would be to keep the music going to enjoy the atmosphere. Other than that, pretty decent prices and the food was delicious üòã

Everything is awesome, from the free nachos and to the entree. Portions are big. We ordered 2 entrees for 2 people. We can't finish it. They have a bar, and seating are plenty. From the outside, we thought it's going to be a small restaurant with 15seats but when you go to the side of the resto, they have many more seats. Food was delicious.

In the last 4 weeks i have been here a handful of times. Tacos are always amazing here. Chips and salsa are okay. Nachos were served in huge portions. Service staff are always nice and smile. They expanded on one side and i recommend getting a seat in the new expanded dining area.

Great food, generous portions, I loved that the tacos come with the guacamole. It was so delicious. There was so much variety on the menu. The service was great, very attentive and friendly staff. The only downside, from my experience, was the music was a bit loud so it was difficult to have a conversation. Besides that, the food was great. Definitely a family friendly restaurant.

Amazing tacos amazing flavor welcoming service all the waiters with a big smile & excellent customer service, very attentive! Had chicken, al pastor and beef tacos, full of meat & flavor and toppings onions cilantro guacamole, they even give you chips and salsa as soon as you walk in! Definitely one of my new favorite taco places when I‚Äôm around! If your around, don‚Äôt hesitate I promise you won‚Äôt regret it! Ps they even had authentic Mexican coke, that wasn‚Äôt flat and actually made in Mexico 10/10 recommend!
I love this place! I ordered birria tacos and it was delicious!! There were also free complimentary chips which were addicting, and the service was incredible! Muy delicioso!

Standard Mexican taqueria with friendly service and delicious food. We got chalupas and mole poblano. The rice and beans were nicely seasoned and delicious just by themselves. The portion sizes are also big here.

La comida es buena, fuimos todo la familia, probamos sus diferentes platillos, me encantaron sus tacos y su horchata, el molcajete viene con muy poca salsa, muy seco para mi gusto. El servicio fue m√°s o menos, tardaron mucho con las‚Ä¶

At 10:00 I found myself hungry in Jackson heights. I chose Taqueria Coatzingo because it seemed friendly, and was pleasantly surprised. I chose three tacos, which were all terrific. The Birrieria meat melt in my mouth, and the sauce was delicious. The camarones were cooked well and very tasty. The star of the meal was the Orejas. I‚Äôve had them at other places, but this one was a step above. The texture was spot on and the flavor was super. The service was great, and while the place was quite empty, I can tell it has a great atmosphere. Will definitely come back.

Justamente ayer fui con mi amiga a comer algo tradicional de Mexico; Guaraches. Valla que desepcionante: la tortilla bien gruesa, parec√≠a tortilla para tlacoyos, la carne se supone que era de carnitas y sab√≠a a res, no me gust√≥ para nada, aparte de que se tardaron much√≠simo, y trajeron los platos bien sucios (huellas en ellos platos) quer√≠amos comer algo rico y mexicano pero en vez de eso fue un gastadero de tiempo para recibir algo no sabroso y platos sucios.
Creo que el mariachi est√° bien pero son demasiados ruidosos.
No recomiendo este lugar, quiz√° valla en un futuro a ver si las cosas mejoran. Saludos ü´Ç.

To be honest i wanted to have some crispy tacos
And i got disappointed when they told me they only have the soft ones
But the tacos were yummy
They also serve completely nachosüëå
You can try out
It also have a bar.

The chips and salsa are hands down one of the best I‚Äôve ever had ü§§ I can‚Äôt stop eating! I found myself keep returning for their chips and shrimp tacos. Oh the tacos‚Ä¶ they‚Äôre fresh made! Imagining hot shrimps with cheese and guac‚Ä¶ yumüòç

La comida y el servicio son muy buenos las meseras son muy amables.  El √∫nico problema es que dejan entrar a los vendedores ambulantes y uno quiere disfrutar su lunch tranquilamente pero a cada rato entran personas pidiendo que les compres algo, y aunque quiera uno ayudar a todos pues  no se puede.

It's the biggest torta portion i have ever gotten, pay an extra dollar or two for mexican cheese. Very flavorful torta. I got two tacos, chorizo and carnitas, both delicious. Ill be back to try a new dish
Tacos were all very good and tasted very fresh. Family friendly spot
Hands down the BEST shrimp tacos I‚Äôve ever had in New York. Such a fun vibe - we enjoyed our spicy margaritas and the al pastor tacos were another big hit.
Best Mexican food in queens! This place is super authentic. Delicious and fresh every time. My favorite tacos are the carnitas. I highly recommend!

Stopped in here for some tacos and I was surprised. I ordered 3 shrimp tacos, and these were delicious. They had plenty of guacamole, the shrimp was so fresh and it had a nice kick to it with some spiciness. If you‚Äôre in the are these tacos are a must try.

The food here was good with huge portions, what I really couldn't get over was the huge grade pending sign I was staring at while I was sitting down.

I didn't see the sign because we weren't into one entrance and didn't see it but then were sent to the other side where the bar was and that's where I saw the sign

The waitress got my sister's order wrong. She asked for 3 tacos and 4 were brought out. They wound up taking the 4th one off the bill because we never touched it. I ordered flautas one chicken and one steak.  The steak was way too tough. The chicken was better.  It was very spicy from the salsa verde but I love spice.  The salsa & chips were good too & so was my mango margarita (frozen)

Colorful and casual Mexican spot, with a good range of traditional Mexican fare. Chips and salsa were immediately served on arrival and I ordered a torta which was large and delicious. Only downside is I would say the service wasn't particularly friendly or attentive.

I love this place. Authentic Mexican food at reasonable prices. I ordered birria tacos and a limonada to drink. Complimentary totopos and salsa were included. Service was quick and friendly.  The limonada was perfectly refreshing. The birria was plentiful, seasoned well, and delicious. I will go back again and try other options.
Good Restaurant the food it‚Äôs so delicious & prices are ok üòé this restaurant was closed for 4 months for renovations but they don‚Äôt even touch the Bathrooms 1 ‚≠êÔ∏è BATHROOMS‚Ä¶
Comida t√≠pica mexicana la cual es excelente, gran variedad de platos. Recomiendo los tragos y jugos. La atenci√≥n es muy buena. Recomendados 100%.
One of the best tacos al pastor I‚Äôve ever had. Fully stuffed taco too. I‚Äôd recommend getting 4 if you really wanna be satisfied.

Authentic and delicious. This was our second stop on a four restaurant self guided food tour of Jackson Heights so my only regret is that I had to pace myself. Really wanted to try the Cemita since it's Pueblan food, so will have to come‚Ä¶

The tacos are amazing! I love how fresh they always taste. The meat is never hard and dry. We just tried the burrito for the 1st time because the tacos always are ti die for. The burrito was so good. Very filling.

The first I went for lunch, and the tacos were amazing, and just having two was so filling. The meat was juicy, the tortillas perfectly soaked in fat, and everything tasted fresh. However, the tacos in the evening were not nearly as good, and other things were a mixed bag: the quesadillas weren't heated up thoroughly, so the cheese wasn't melted; I didn't care much for the beef cemita, especially the bread. The staff was friendly and attentive. Sometimes they play the music way too loud to talk.

La atenci√≥n de Daniela Trejo fue maravillosa, la comida es deliciosa pero definitivamente voy a volver por su atenci√≥n. Vinimos a celebrar un cumplea√±os y fue muy atenta, nos atendi√≥ con una sonrisa , muy organizada y muy atenta.

Estoy muy decepcionada con el servicio. Lo cierto es que la comida es excepcionalmente buena y no tengo ninguna queja respecto a los cocineros. Sin embargo, el hecho de que la mesera intente aprovecharse de la gratificaci√≥n incluida en la cuenta es muy sospechoso. Comprendo la necesidad de dejar propina, pero esta es la segunda vez que exageran con la gratificaci√≥n. En esta ocasi√≥n, mi esposo y yo fuimos a tomar dos caf√©s y un desayuno; en ning√∫n momento se acerc√≥ a preguntar si necesit√°bamos algo m√°s y, cuando lo hicimos, no estaba disponible. Tuvimos que pedir a otra persona una coca-cola y dos tacos. Al final, nos entreg√≥ la cuenta con un 20% de gratificaci√≥n, cuando solo √©ramos dos personas. Espero que el gerente lea esto; tal vez necesite aumentar el salario de sus meseras. Simplemente siento que es una cuesti√≥n de principios. Gerente eduquen a sus meseras que en el estado de NYC si son dos personas comiendo NUNCA se debe de poner gratitude. NO SE DEJEN ROBAR

AWESOME TACOS! Highly recommend checking out. Also the yummiest marg I‚Äôve had in my whole life!
